obs.ontologyAccess
Class AbstractOntologyAccessTool

java.lang.Object
  obs.ontologyAccess.AbstractOntologyAccessTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
OntologyAccess
Direct Known Subclasses:
BioPortalAccessTool, UmlsAccessTool
public abstract class AbstractOntologyAccessTool
extends java.lang.Object
implements OntologyAccess

This abstract class is used as a generic ontology and terminology access and manipulation tool. It defines a set of methods that abstract on the following ontologies/terminologies API:

  • UMLS, available as a database;
  • BioPortal, available through a REST web service API.
A tool has a name and gives access to a set of ontologies/terminologies (after denoted ontologies only).

This set of ontologies is implemented by means of an HashSet that contains the String used to identify the ontologies in the different systems, called later localOntologyID:

  • SABs for UMLS (e.g., "SNOMEDCT", "MSHCZE");
  • ontology URIs for BioPortal, called BPOntologyID (i.e., end of the ontology URI) (e.g., 38378).
Note: some functions are restricted to the set of ontologies accessed by the tool, some function work for any ontology with a valid localOntologyID (e.g., getOntologyName). A tool allows to manipulate concepts in a given system. Concepts are identified with the appropriated format for each system. The assumption taken by the OntologyAccessTool is that a concept ID, called later localConceptID , is globally unique for a given system i.e., a concept is unique in a given ontology. LocalConceptID format are:
  • couple SAB/CUI for UMLS (e.g., NCIT/C0001175);
  • concept URIs for BioPortal, called BPConceptID (i.e., the end of the concept URI) (e.g., 38378/DOID:1909)

Version:
1.0
Author:
Clement Jonquet

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getLocalConceptIDs(java.lang.String localOntologyID)
                                                       throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException
Returns the set of all localConceptID contains in a given ontology. Implements a traverse of the ontology using the getRootConcepts and the getConceptChildren functions. May be overrided for better performance.

mapStringToLocalConceptIDs

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> mapStringToLocalConceptIDs(java.lang.String s,
                                                                      boolean exactMap)
For a given String, returns the set of concepts in all the ontologies accessed by the tool for which the given String is (i) exactly equal to one of the concept names if the flag is true; (ii) contained into one of the concept names if the flag is false; May be overrided for better performance.

getAllOntologyMappings

public abstract java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String[]> getAllOntologyMappings(java.lang.String localOntologyID)
                                                                      throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException
Returns a set of triplets [localConceptID, mappedLocalConceptID, mappingType] saying that the localConceptID is mapped to (according to mappingType) mappedLocalConceptID localConceptID is in the first given ontology; mappedLocalConceptID is in one ontology accessed by the tool (including the one given (internal mappings)).

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalOntologyIDException

getConceptParents

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptParents(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                                          throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns a hashtable that represents the set of concepts of all the parents (recursively to the ontology root). The hashtable keys are the localConceptID and the values are the level in the hierarchy (parents=1, grand-parents=2, ...). If there are several path to the root with different levels, we keep the shortest level for a concept. The current implementation implements a breadth first search algorithm. May be overrided for better performance. Cycles are removed, otherwise the recursion loops.

Specified by:
getConceptParents in interface OntologyAccess
Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptChildren

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getConceptChildren(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                                           throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
For a given concept, returns a hashtable that represents the set of concepts of all the children (recursively to the leaves). The hashtable keys are the localConceptID and the values are the level in the hierarchy (child=1, grand-child=2, ...). If there are several path to the same leave with different levels, we keep the shortest level for a concept. The current implementation implements a breadth first search algorithm. May be overrided for better performance.

Specified by:
getConceptChildren in interface OntologyAccess
Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException

getConceptPtrs

public abstract java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getConceptPtrs(java.lang.String localConceptID)
                                                            throws OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
Returns a set of path to the root (PTRs) for a given concept. PTRs are represented as a list of localConceptIDs, separated by periods (.) The first one in the list is top of the hierarchy; the last one in the list is the direct parent of the concept.

Throws:
OntologyAccess.NonValidLocalConceptIDException
